eventDetails: These events are suitable for those who already have a regular meditation practice and want to continue to do so in a supportive environment with other meditators. eventDetails: Come join us every Friday evening for 1 hour of Bhagavad Gita Discussions starting at 18:00 until 19:00. we try to read 5 verses from the Bhagavad Gita along with its translation and the purport by His Divine Grace A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada who is the founder of the ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness ) also known as the Hare Krishna. You are welcome to join us along with your family and friends where you can also participate in this event. After the 1 hour of Bhagavad Gita Discussion, we then switch to 2 hours of Mantra Meditation between 19:00 to 21:00 where different people lead the Mantra Meditation (Kirtan) during these 2 hours. This event usually ends with ecstatic singing of the Kirtan where people stand up and dance. and when we speak of Hare Krishna, we also speak of free food, the event ends with the distribution of some snacks and or sweets on most Fridays.
eventName: Bhagavad Gita As It Is Discussions & Mantra Meditation (Kirtan)

eventDetails:
FREE TICKETS AT THE LINK BELOW
Tickets! Discover a different side to Dublin. Ever wonder... what's down there? Well my friend today is the day we explore the alternative side to Dublin. Come check out a chocolate factory, fruit market, hidden bar, time house, art gallery and many more unique places. This will be a two hour tour and end in Temple Bar. This tour is great way to get social and meet new people - lots of people come alone so don't be shy! We are meeting outside the Ambassador Theatre at 1pm on Friday.

groupName: Things To Do In Dublin  -  Events, Tours, Walks
eventDetails:
Join us on an adventure across Dublin city hearing the myths and the terrifying legends that stalk our streets. Tickets can be bought at the link below!
TICKETS!! Visit haunted buildings, hear harrowing tales of horror and creepy legends.
Discover some stories from the past and a different side to Dublin
We have a long tradition of storytelling in Ireland and our oldest stories are of the banshees, the ghosts and the things that keep you up at night. These stories were traditionally told around a fire but we will be heading to the spaces where these things happened, hearing the stories and seeing for ourselves. Embrace the supernatural and come on a ghostly adventure with us.
Some of what we cover:
-Maud Gonne's shocking ghostly secrets
-The unexplained terrors that have been seen in the Shelbourne hotel
-The grisly hangings near St Stephens Green
-The gruesome tales of the Tenements
-The 'Resurrection Men'
-Charlie Parker and the haunting of the Olympia Theatre
-The Zombie experimenter of Anglesea Street
-Darkey Kelly and her basement of Bodies
-The Dolocher, The Demon pig of Dublin
& So much more!
eventName: Legends, Ghosts and Ghouls of Dublin (PAID) | Walking Tour

eventDetails:
Cost: 5 euros. RSVP Opens on Friday 5th April at 09:00
Come and join us for a tour to learn about this iconic Dublin landmark building.
The present building was designed by James Gandon and work commenced in 1781. it took ten years to complete and cost ¬£200,000. The tour of the Visitors Centre tell us about the history of the building and the work it undertook. It was burnt down in the Civil War; we will also hear some interesting stories associated with it. Afterwards we will go to Abbey Street to coffee and a chat. There will also be the option of something to eat. We'll meet at 10:45 by the Reception of the Museum, the tour starts PROMPTLY at 11:00. Unfortunately, we can't wait for late comers. Details: 1. RSVP to event by pressing ATTEND.
2. Then Pay the 5 euros using the link below.
3.Remember to select 'Friends' and to write your name and state the
event that you are paying for
4. https://paypal.me/HistoryChris?country.x=IE&locale.x=en_US
5. It will take 24 hours for the unpaid marked by your name to change to Paid
3 Afterwards we will go for coffee/lunch and chat.
4. We look forward to seeing you there.
eventName: Tour of the Custom House Visitor Centre

eventDetails:
You'll meet your local guide at the meeting point a little before 11AM and show your booking. Then we'll commence a fascinating walking tour through the streets, sights, and sounds of Dublin old and new. You'll get an unrivalled insight to the history and culture that has shaped the capital you see today - warts and all, discover the lesser-known, intriguing oddities of our city, and get unique insider tips for the rest of your stay.
Sites and topics covered include:
Dublin Castle, Christchurch, Viking & Medieval Dublin, Temple Bar, fables, folklore and mythology, Trinity College, Stephen's Green, risings and rebellions, writers & rogues and so, so much more... please remember, places are limited and you must book your spot via: https://www.generationtours.com/dublin See you soon!

Open level K-Pop classes in Dublin by a professional K-Pop dance instructor. I trained in Seoul and have over 10 years of K-Pop experience. 8pm is the Girl Style class, with dances by girl groups like XG, Le Sserafim, New Jeans, Blackpink, STAYC and more. (Song choice is determined with students in classes from week to week) Friday classes are for having fun and enjoying K-Pop, while building your dance skills through stretching, basic steps and step by step teaching of the choreography. Classes are designed to be suitable for beginners, while more advanced students will get extra tips and details throughout the class to keep their skills progressing and add challenge. Choreography is covered over 1 to 2 weeks. We cover the chorus/killing part of each dance.

Join us for an empowering and inspiring evening dedicated to celebrating the strength, wisdom, and resilience of incredible women. Exciting Announcement! Join Our Female Leader Meetup organised by Diversity Ireland and The Web3 Passport podcast üåü
Calling all aspiring and established female leaders! üì£ Are you ready to ignite your leadership potential and connect with like-minded women? Then mark your calendars for our upcoming Female Leader Meetup!
üóì Date: 12th April, 2024
üïï Time: 6:30 - 9:00 PM
üìç Location: BrewDog Outpost, Dublin Docks At this empowering event, we'll be diving into dynamic discussions, sharing insights, and fostering meaningful connections among female leaders from diverse backgrounds and industries. Whether you're a seasoned executive, an emerging entrepreneur, or simply passionate about leadership, this meetup is designed for you. Here's what you can expect:
‚ú® If you are an entrepreneur and have a new budding start-up please join us and network.
‚ú® Engaging in discussions on navigating challenges and seizing opportunities.
‚ú® If you are looking to build your network and currently seeking new opportunities, this is a great event to receive mentoring and guidance.
‚ú® Networking sessions to connect with fellow women leaders and expand your professional circle.
‚ú® Great event to gain valuable mentoring and guidance and to feel inspired by the stories of the female leaders present in the event.
This meetup is not just about sharing ideas; it's about sparking meaningful collaborations, supporting each other's growth, and paving the way for future generations of female leaders.
Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to elevate your leadership journey and be part of a community dedicated to empowerment and success. RSVP now to secure your spot!
Let's lead, inspire, and empower together. See you at the Female Leader Meetup! Please also checkout more information about the event on the eventbrite - https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/elevateher-meet-female-leaders-entrepreneurs-and-riseup-tickets-860519736697?utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-medium=discovery&utm-term=listing&utm-source=cp&aff=ebdsshcopyurl
